titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Paul Seel (1904-1982) was a prominent mineralogist and micromounter in Pennsylvania, with training in crystallography and optical mineralogy. He was a member of the Leidy Microscopical Society and the Philadelphia Mineralogical Society, also serving as that group's president. In 1936, he married Hildegard Marie Adelheid (1901-1987), who shared his interest in minerals. The Seels were avid collectors, and upon Paul Seel's death a portion of the couple's collection was donated to the Wagner Free Institute of Science.

scopecontent.p: The Paul and Hilde Seel papers are comprised of multiple accessions. The first part (collection 90-025) includes naturalization papers and marriage certificate for Paul and Hilde Seel, photographs, correspondence with Harry Trudell and Edgar Wherry, Trudell/Clifford Frondel correspondence, pamphlets and articles including "New and little-known corals of the Florida Formation" (1973) by Norman E. Weisbord and a "Re-examination of Legrandite" (1963) by Paul E. Desautels and Roy E. Clark, Jr. Other materials include a scrapbook (collection 92-012), which consists chiefly of photographs and memorabilia compiled by Paul and Hilde Seel relating to the 21st Annual Convention of the Eastern Federation of Mineralogical & Lapidary Societies held in Lake Placid, NY, June 1971. Accompanying materials include convention programs, stamps, one album sheet, and a paper given by Paul Seel titled "Observations on Diamond Crystals" at the 20th Annual Convention of the International Diamond Association of America, March 5, 1965.

controlaccess.corpname: Eastern Federation of Mineralogical and Lapidary Societies.
controlaccess.subject: Crystallography.
Mineralogy.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: Harry W. Trudell papers (92-017) includes a small amount of Trudell's correspondence, plus reprints he collected.
